identificationModule.briefTitle: Physiological Effects of ANGPTL3 Variants in Humans
identificationModule.officialTitle: Physiological Effects of ANGPTL3 Variants in Humans

collaborators.name: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To evaluate the role of ANGPTL3, on lipid metabolism. To explore the role of this protein on glucose metabolism.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Oral fast tolerance test, lipoprotein kinetics and a glucose tolerance test to evaluate the role of ANGPTL3, on lipid metabolism and to explore the role of this protein on glucose metabolism.

armGroups.label: Variant
interventionNames: Other: Kinetics test, oral fat tolerance test, and an oral glucose tolerance test.

armGroups.label: Non-variant
armGroups.description: Healthy volunteers with no ANGPTL3 variants
interventionNames: Other: Kinetics test, oral fat tolerance test, and an oral glucose tolerance test.

interventions.name: Kinetics test, oral fat tolerance test, and an oral glucose tolerance test.
interventions.description: Subjects will participate in a kinetics test, oral fat tolerance test, and an oral glucose tolerance test.

primaryOutcomes.measure: The role of ANGPTL3 on lipid metabolism.
primaryOutcomes.description: Assessing ApoB-containing lipoprotein fractional catabolic rate
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, an average of 13 weeks

primaryOutcomes.measure: The role of this protein on glucose metabolism.
primaryOutcomes.description: Looking for glucose area under the curve following Oral Glucose Tolerance Test
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, an average of 13 weeks

primaryOutcomes.measure: The role of ANPTL3 on fatty acids
primaryOutcomes.description: Looking for fatty acids area under the curve following Oral Fat Tolerance Test
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, an average of 13 weeks

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Subjects aged 18 or older meeting at least one of the following criteria

  1. Carrying genetic variants in the gene encoding for ANGPTL3,
  2. Unaffected controls matched for age, race, gender,
  3. Willing to follow study procedures
  4. Able to provide inform consent

     Exclusion Criteria:
* Any medical or psychological conditions that, in the opinion of the investigator, would compromise the subject's safety or successful participation in the study, or confound the study data
* Taking any medication that, in the opinion of the investigator, would compromise the subject's safety or successful participation in the study, or confound the study data
* Women that are pregnant or nursing
* History of liver disease or abnormal liver function tests (\>2x upper limit of normal)
* History of kidney disease or chronic renal insufficiency (eGFR \<60 mL/min/1.73 m2)
* Uncontrolled hypertension (\>160/100 mmHg)
* Uncontrolled diabetes
* Anemia (hemoglobin \<11.0 mg/dL) History of a non-skin malignancy within the previous 5 years Major surgery within the past 3 months
* History of any organ transplant
* History of alcohol or drug abuse
* Participation in clinical trials assessing the efficacy and safety of drugs affecting lipid metabolism within the past 6 weeks (or longer depending on the known half-life of the drug) that, in the opinion of the investigator, would compromise the subject's safety or successful participation in the study, or confound the study data
* Inability to comply to study procedures
